title: CHEMICAL MECHANICAL POLISHING SLURRY COMPOSITION FOR POLISHING MULTIPLE FILMS AND POLISHING METHOD USING THE SAME

samples.experiment_context: CMP slurry with 1 wt% silica, 0.08 wt% succinic acid, 0.03 wt% HEC (90k MW), 0.05 wt% PEG (600 MW), 0.025 wt% PAA (2k MW), pH 3.5 adjusted with triethanolamine.
Same as Example 1, but with 0.005 wt% PAA (2k MW).
Same as Example 1, but with 0.005 wt% PAA (10k MW, denoted PAA 5X).
Same as Example 1, but pH adjusted to 4.5.
Same as Example 1, but pH 4.5 and 0.005 wt% PAA (2k MW).
Same as Example 1, but pH 4.5 and 0.005 wt% PAA (10k MW, denoted PAA 5X).
Same as Example 1, but pH 4.5 and 0.0025 wt% PAA (10k MW, denoted PAA 5X).
Same as Example 1, but no defect improving agent (PAA) added.
Same as Comparative Example 1, but pH adjusted to 4.5.
Same as Example 1, but pH adjusted to 2.5.
Same as Example 1, but with 0.15 wt% PAA (2k MW).
Same as Example 1, but with 0.001 wt% PAA (10k MW, denoted PAA 5X).
Same as Example 1, but pH 4.5 and 0.001 wt% PAA (10k MW, denoted PAA 5X).
Same as Example 1, but pH 7.5 and 0.005 wt% PAA (10k MW, denoted PAA 5X).
Same as Example 1, but defect improving agent is 0.025 wt% polystyrene sulfonic acid (PSSA).
Same as Example 1, but defect improving agent is 0.05 wt% 2-acrylamido-2-methylpropane sulfonic acid (AMPS).
Same as Example 1, but defect improving agent is 0.025 wt% ammonium lauryl sulfate (ALS).
Same as Example 1, but defect improving agent is 0.025 wt% ammonium persulfate (APS).
